content: On November 25, 1996, the Atlanta Braves made a significant trade that would impact their pitching staff for years to come. The Braves acquired right-handed pitcher Greg Maddux from the Chicago Cubs, marking the beginning of a legendary era for the franchise. Maddux would go on to win four consecutive Cy Young Awards while with the Braves, solidifying his status as one of the greatest pitchers in baseball history and playing a crucial role in Atlanta's dominance in the 1990s.
